chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof starting with "```coq
", ending with "Qed.```", without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```coq
simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```coq
intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Solve This Proof State:

Hypotheses:
n: nat
v: Vector.t nat n

Goal:
vec_sum v = 0 -> v = vec_zero

Premises:
Inductive t : nat -> Set := F1 : forall n : nat, pos (S n) | FS : forall n : nat, pos n -> pos (S n) Arguments Fin.t _%nat_scope Arguments Fin.F1 {n}%nat_scope Arguments Fin.FS {n}%nat_scope
vec_sum : forall n : nat, vec nat n -> nat
Inductive nat : Set := O : nat | S : nat -> nat Arguments S _%nat_scope
Module Vector := Struct Inductive t (A : Type) : nat -> Type := nil : t A 0 | cons : A -> forall n : nat, t A n -> t A (S n) Definition t_rect : forall (A : Type) (P : forall n : nat, vec A n -> Type), P 0 vec_nil -> (forall (h : A) (n : nat) (t : vec A n), P n t -> P (S n) (h ## t)) -> forall (n : nat) (t : vec A n), P n t. Definition t_ind : forall (A : Type) (P : forall n : nat, vec A n -> Prop), P 0 vec_nil -> (forall (h : A) (n : nat) (t : vec A n), P n t -> P (S n) (h ## t)) -> forall (n : nat) (t : vec A n
vec_sum_zero : forall n : nat, vec_sum vec_zero = 0
vec_sum_plus : forall (n : nat) (v w : vec nat n), vec_sum (vec_plus v w) = vec_sum v + vec_sum w
Init.Nat.pred = fun n : nat => match n with | 0 => n | S u => u end : nat -> nat Arguments Init.Nat.pred _%nat_scope
Init.Nat.sub = fix sub (n m : nat) {struct n} : nat := match n with | 0 => n | S k => match m with | 0 => n | S l => sub k l end end : nat -> nat -> nat Arguments Init.Nat.sub (_ _)%nat_scope
Init.Nat.mul = fix mul (n m : nat) {struct n} : nat := match n with | 0 => 0 | S p => m + mul p m end : nat -> nat -> nat Arguments Init.Nat.mul (_ _)%nat_scope
BinIntDef.Z.of_nat = fun n : nat => match n with | 0 => BinNums.Z0 | S n0 => BinNums.Zpos (BinPos.Pos.of_succ_nat n0) end : nat -> BinNums.Z Arguments BinIntDef.Z.of_nat _%nat_scope
vec_sum_one : forall (n : nat) (p : pos n), vec_sum (vec_one p) = 1
VectorSpec.take_O : forall (le : 0 <= ?n) (v0 : vec ?A ?n), VectorDef.take 0 le v0 = vec_nil where ?A : [n : nat v : vec nat n |- Type] ?n : [n : nat v : vec nat n |- nat]
VectorSpec.nth_map2 : forall (f : ?A -> ?B -> ?C) (n0 : nat) (v0 : vec ?A n0) (w : vec ?B n0) (p1 p2 p3 : pos n0), p1 = p2 -> p2 = p3 -> VectorDef.nth (VectorDef.map2 f v0 w) p1 = f (VectorDef.nth v0 p2) (VectorDef.nth w p3) where ?A : [n : nat v : vec nat n |- Type] ?B : [n : nat v : vec nat n |- Type] ?C : [n : nat v : vec nat n |- Type]
Init.Nat.add = fix add (n m : nat) {struct n} : nat := match n with | 0 => m | S p => S (add p m) end : nat -> nat -> nat Arguments Init.Nat.add (_ _)%nat_scope
tail_plus = fix tail_plus (n m : nat) {struct n} : nat := match n with | 0 => m | S n0 => tail_plus n0 (S m) end : nat -> nat -> nat Arguments tail_plus (_ _)%nat_scope
pos_O_inv = let pos_inv_t := fun n : nat => match n as x return (pos x -> Set) with | 0 => fun _ : pos 0 => False | S n0 => fun i : pos (S n0) => ((i = pos0) + {p : pos n0 | i = pos_nxt p})%type end in let pos_inv := fun (_tmp : nat) (p0 : pos _tmp) => match p0 as t in (pos n) return (pos_inv_t n t) with | @Fin.F1 n => inl eq_refl | @Fin.FS n p => inr (exist (fun p1 : pos n => pos_nxt p = pos_nxt p1) p eq_refl) end in pos_inv 0 : pos 0 -> False
gt = fun n m : nat => m < n : nat -> nat -> Prop Arguments gt (_ _)%nat_scope
lt = fun n m : nat => S n <= m : nat -> nat -> Prop Arguments lt (_ _)%nat_scope
minus_n_O : forall n : nat, n = n - 0
plus_n_O : forall n : nat, n = n + 0
VectorEq.cast : vec ?A ?m -> forall n0 : nat, ?m = n0 -> vec ?A n0 where ?A : [n : nat v : vec nat n |- Type] ?m : [n : nat v : vec nat n |- nat]
vec_plus_is_zero : forall (n : nat) (u v : vec nat n), vec_zero = vec_plus u v -> u = vec_zero /\ v = vec_zero
VectorSpec.nth_map : forall (f : ?A -> ?B) (n0 : nat) (v0 : vec ?A n0) (p1 p2 : pos n0), p1 = p2 -> VectorDef.nth (VectorDef.map f v0) p1 = f (VectorDef.nth v0 p2) where ?A : [n : nat v : vec nat n |- Type] ?B : [n : nat v : vec nat n |- Type]
VectorSpec.append_splitat : forall (v0 : vec ?A ?n) (w : vec ?A ?m) (vw : vec ?A (?n + ?m)), VectorDef.splitat ?n vw = (v0, w) -> vw = VectorDef.append v0 w where ?A : [n : nat v : vec nat n |- Type] ?n : [n : nat v : vec nat n |- nat] ?m : [n : nat v : vec nat n |- nat]
vec_zero_S : forall n : nat, vec_zero = 0 ## vec_zero
vec_plus = fun (n : nat) (v w : vec nat n) => vec_set_pos (fun p : pos n => (v#>p) + (w#>p)) : forall n : nat, vec nat n -> vec nat n -> vec nat n Arguments vec_plus {n}%nat_scope
VectorSpec.fold_left_right_assoc_eq : (forall (a : ?A) (b c : ?B), ?f (?f a b) c = ?f (?f a c) b) -> forall (n0 : nat) (v0 : vec ?B n0) (a : ?A), VectorDef.fold_left ?f a v0 = VectorDef.fold_right (fun (x : ?B) (y : ?A) => ?f y x) v0 a where ?A : [n : nat v : vec nat n |- Type] ?B : [n : nat v : vec nat n |- Type] ?f : [n : nat v : vec nat n |- ?A -> ?B -> ?A]
case0 : forall P : vec ?A 0 -> Type, P vec_nil -> forall v : vec ?A 0, P v where ?A : [n : nat v : vec nat n |- Type]
VectorDef.case0 : forall P : vec ?A 0 -> Type, P vec_nil -> forall v : vec ?A 0, P v where ?A : [n : nat v : vec nat n |- Type]

```coq
intros H.
induction v.
- simpl in H. rewrite vec_sum_zero in H. discriminate.
- simpl in H. rewrite vec_sum_plus in H. apply IHv in H. subst. simpl. rewrite vec_sum_one in H. discriminate.
Qed.```
